initSaveRestore.caretaker

Class TaskManCaretaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • initSaveRestore.caretaker.TaskManCaretaker

  • public class TaskManCaretaker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the system caretaker. It is responsible for creating system snapshots in order to save and restore a system image.
    Author:
    Tim Van Den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel and Eli Vangrieken

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Facade facade

      Constructs a caretaker linked to a specific facade

    • Field Detail

      • mementos

        private final java.util.Stack<TaskManMemento> mementos

      • facade

        private final Facade facade

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskManCaretaker

        public TaskManCaretaker(Facade facade)
        Constructs a caretaker linked to a specific facade
        Parameters:
        facade - | the facade with which the caretaker will talk (its taskman can be saved and restored)

    • Method Detail

      • storeInMemento

        public void storeInMemento()
        Store in memento will push a memento of the current system on a stack for safekeeping. Every system state should be storeable.

      • buildMemento

        private java.lang.String buildMemento()
        The Build Memento method will ask the system for specific details about its current state. This happens through the facade. The method will return a string in the format of a TMAN file. These TMAN files can be considered snapshots of a system and are also used for initialization at startup.
        Returns:
        The TMAN string based upon the current state of the system

      • revertFromMemento

        public boolean revertFromMemento()
        This method will ask the facade to recreate its current TaskMan. This TaskMan will be initialized with values stored in the memento on the top of the stack. In the case of a simulation, the last simulation started will be reverted first.
        Returns:
        True if the system was initialized without errors, false otherwise

      • discardMemento

        public boolean discardMemento()
        The top memento of the memento stack will be removed
        Returns:
        True if the memento was removed without a problem, false otherwise
